newsitem.title: INDIA: India PM inducts Kashmir leader into cabinet.
newsitem.headline: India PM inducts Kashmir leader into cabinet.

text.p: Indian Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda on Thursday inducted two ministers, including one from troubled Kashmir, into his cabinet in an expansion of his centre-left coalition.
Saifuddin Soz, a lawmaker of the National Conference party of the state of Jammu and Kashmir, was given a cabinet rank.
M.P. Veerendra Kumar, a lawmaker from the southern Indian state of Kerala, was inducted as a minister of state (junior minister).
A government spokesman said their portfolios would be announced later.
The entry of Soz, whose regional party won local elections in Kashmir that were held after a gap of nine years in 1996, took the number of parties in the United Front cabinet to 13.
India held local elections in the northern state, mainly Hindu India's only Moslem-majority province, in a move seen as a containment of a separatist rebellion that began in 1990.
Two parties are members of the ruling political alliance, but are not represented in the government.
